divs: Sighting DetailsMy bird and I were getting some sun when she became fixated on something. Thinking it was a hawk I looked and she was starring at an extremely bright white light in the sky, just about 2 o'clock from straight up. My first thought was that it was a planet. But, it was much brighter and larger than I have seen. I asked my husband to get the binoculars to take a better look. In the 2-3 minutes it took him the light started to very slowly move away like it was going down south but not seeming to change how high-up it was. When we looked at it with the binoculars it was just a bright pure white light, no outline or other colors. If I had to give it a shape it would be round, like the light of a flashlight, but I could not call it a sphere. In the past we have seen metallic balloons, the bird hates them, and they move bouncy with the air and tend to flicker with the light reflection, so I am pretty sure it was not a balloon. We took turns looking with the binoculars and watched it for approx 10-15 minutes before it became to small to see. No matter what it was it was a unique experience.
trends: There have been 5 other sightings in Lakewood
There were no other sightings in Lakewood on or around September 19th 2009
